Kerala Beach Tour: A Delightful Experience

From all over the world tourists in quite large number visit India to explore its exquisite beaches. India has the most diverse varieties of beaches anywhere in the world. In India there are several fascinating destination that are globally known for beach tourism and providing wonderful holiday options. Goa, Orissa, Gujarat and Kerala are known for their exquisite beauty and several other attractions. Serene & scenic backwaters, placid lagoons, palm coconut fringed shores, bays, powdery golden & silvery sand, enchanting surf, and delicious sea-foods, make India’s beaches very popular among tourists from all over the world. Beach holidays and beach tourism in India are undoubtedly a delightful experience.

Kerala is one of the most popular destinations for beach tourism and beach holidays in India. It is one of the most beautiful states of India and widely known for its exquisite beaches blessed with exceptional nature beauty. The state is also known for several other attractions like breathtaking backwaters, verdant hill stations, tea gardens, lush plantations, wildlife sanctuaries, national parks, landscape beauty and rich culture & traditions.

Kerala is undoubtedly a perfect beach destination where one can enjoy amazing beach tourism with several other attractions. Beaches of the state are dotted with palm coconut trees, golden & silvery sands, rocky promontories and blessed with exceptional nature beauty. Definitely beaches of Kerala are the most popular attractions of every Kerala tour itinerary. Beaches of Kerala are known for gentle surf and blue waters that please your sense of Kerala tours. Beaches have great serenity and delightful ambiance.

Due to exceptional nature beauty and serene ambiance Kerala beaches are also very popular among honeymoon couples. Honeymoon couples from all over the world embark on Kerala honeymoon tour quite in large number. For honeymooner Kerala beaches are like a dream destination. When it comes to honeymoon in Kerala, honeymoon couples always prefer beaches and backwaters because of exceptional nature beauty and serene ambiance. Celebrating honeymoon holidays here is simply a romantic experience.

There are several beach destinations in Kerala known for exquisite beauty and wonderful holiday options. They are Kovalam Beach, Kumarakom Beach, Alleppey Beach, Beypore Beach, Varkala Beach, Fort Kochi Beach, Fort Bekal Beach, Marai Beach, Kappad Beach, Muzhappilangad Beach, Ezhimala Beach, Dharmadam Island, Sankhumugham Beach, Payyambalam Beach, Tanur Beach, Thirumullavaram Beach, Thangassery Beach, Mopila Bay, etc.

These beaches of Kerala are known for their great scenic beauty and mind relaxing serenity. These beaches provide wonderful opportunity to indulge in several fascinating activities. One can enjoy swimming in calm and peaceful water. One can enjoy breathtaking sunsets. One can enjoy beach volley ball. Delicious sea foods are also additional advantages of Kerala beach tours. One can have a nature walk in the early morning – a delightful experience. Filled with coconut palms and green bushes beached provide breathtaking sight to please your sense of Kerala package tours.

Beaches are dotted with several luxury hotels and ayurvedic treatment resorts and massage centers. They provide world class accommodation as well as ayurvedic treatments and massage therapy. Ayurveda in Kerala is great way to get rejuvenated and revitalized.

To explore the exquisite beaches of the state you can select one of Kerala tour packages made available by various tour operators and travel agents. If you too are interested in beach tourism book your tour package in Kerala that makes you enable to explore predominant and exquisite beaches of the state. Well, get ready to treasure delightful experience of Kerala beach tourism.

Predominant Beaches of Kerala

Kerala is one of the most captivating and charming states of India. It is widely known for its exquisite beaches blessed with extraordinary nature beauty. Scenic backwaters, palm coconut dotted shore, golden & silver beaches, gentle surf, blue azure waters, lush busy plants on the shores, etc are team up together and make Kerala’s beaches globally famous destination for beach tourism. No one think of complete Kerala tours without exploring exquisite beaches that are known for great scenic beauty and serenity. Touring breathtaking beaches of the state is a delightful experience. The state has some of fines beaches in the world. Some of predominant beaches of Kerala are listed below.

• Kovalam Beach:
It is perhaps the most fascinating beaches of the state. It was a previously a small village along the shoreline. Now it has been developed into a world class beach resort. It provides wonderful opportunity to beach tourism and great beach holiday experience. You should not forget to visit Kovalam beach during your Kerala beach tours.

• Kumarakom Beach:
It is one of the most picturesque beaches of the state. Apart from beaches it is also known for breathtaking beautiful backwaters blessed with exceptional nature beauty and Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary. One can enjoy houseboat cruise over the breathtaking backwaters of Kumarakom and enjoy bird watching of Kumarakom bird sanctuary. A must visit beach and backwaters destination of Kerala!

• Marai Beach:
It was a local fishing village and now it is popular beach destination of the state. It is dotted with endless miles of superb sandy beaches dotted with swaying palm coconut trees. You will have wonderful opportunity to enjoy delicious sea foods and local charm of traditional Kerala.

• Alleppey Beach:
Alleppey is one of the most popular beach and backwater destinations of the state. It is very popular for houseboat cruise over the tranquil and scenic backwaters. A houseboat trip over Alleppey backwaters is also very popular among honeymoon couples. Surly it will be a delightful and romantic experience of Kerala honeymoon tour . Alleppey is dotted with several ayurvedic treatment resorts and massage centers providing natural way to get refreshed and rejuvenated.

• Beypore Beach:
It was one of prominent ports and fishing harbors of ancient Kerala. It is well known for its ancient ship building industry. It is locally famous as a perfect picnic sport.

• Fort Kochi Beach:
It is a must visit attraction of every Kerala package tours. Visit the Fort Kochi Beach and Backwater and treasure several memorable experience. Have a leisurely walk through the lanes of Kochi. Visit to the Fort Kochi or visit world famous Chinese Fishing Nets – really a charming and captivating experience of tour package in Kerala, India.

Apart form above mentioned beaches there are also several exquisite beaches in Kerala that are known for their great serenity and scenic beauty. They are Varkala Beach, Kappad Beach, Tanur Beach, Ezhimala Beach, Thirumullavaram Beach, Thangassery Beach, etc.

Beaches of the state are also very popular among honeymoon couples. Honeymoon couples willing to honeymoon in Kerala often prefer its exquisite beaches and backwaters. Beaches and backwaters of the state provide honeymooners wonderful opportunity to celebrate their honeymoon holidays in scenic and peaceful ambiance. Wonderful sunset, lush green landscape and amazing tourism create romantic ambiance for honeymoon holidays. Well select one of Kerala tour packages that cover predominant beaches of the state and get ready to experience real charm of Kerala tours.

Shimla (the capital of Himachal Pradesh), Manali, Kullu, etc are the prime destinations of the Himachal Pradesh, India.

While in Kullu, you will see various lively valleys blooming with wild flowers. Also you will surely to love to marvel at captivating view of snow-covered mountain peaks.

Manali is 40 km away from Kullu to the north. There are numerous options to do and see in this beautiful hill station of northern India. Snow-covered mountain peaks, fruit orchards, wooden slopes, meadows with blooming flowers, lush green valleys, deodar & pine forests, etc are some prime highlights of travel and tourism in Manali.

In fact, entire Himachal Pradesh is endowed with superb nature and exploring the scenic beauty of this state provides you ambiance life paradise. Tourism in Kullu and Manali

The charming valleys of Kullu and Manali epitomize nature at its best. The towering Himalayan hill wrapped in the shimmering white snows of winter, the scenic slopes, sprawling spans of valleys with colorful wild flowers, river running along, meadows of wild flowers spreading their fragrance far and far…all these create a wonderful environment for wonderful holiday. No doubt, Kullu Manali tour deserves the attention of tourists from all over the world.

You will surly left spellbound on tours and travel in the enchanting region of Kullu and Manali by the charming surroundings and fresh-looking delicacy of hilly landscapes. The beauty of the region of Kullu and Manali lies in its breathtaking scenic beauty and panoramic snow covered mountains. And that’s why the region claims to be called the Switzerland of India.

The hill town of Kullu (also known as the Valley of Gods) is located on the banks of Beas River on the western Himalayan region. The remarkable feature of Kullu town is lush meadows of wild flowers and exceptional panoramic views. The town is also known for its religious importance. Travellers can visit the ancient magnificent temples like the Bijli Mahadeo Temple, Raghunathji Temple and Manikaran.

There are several fascinating destinations like Kothi, Rahala Falls, Solang Valley, etc in the hill town of Manali that can be explored on the Kullu Manali tours . You too can explore these destinations with the famous apple orchard and several nature trails on your tours and travel in Himachal Pradesh.

The region of Kullu and Manali is also famous amongst trekkers and adventure sports buffs. The region offer a wide range of adventure and sport options to be played and enjoyed, such as, trekking, mountaineering, rock climbing, river rafting, para gliding, heli skiing, etc. You will too surly to love to enjoy these adventurous activities during tours for Manali and Kullu.

Among various tourist attractions, the Great Himalayan National Park and the Kanawar Sanctuary also deserve the attention of wildlife lovers to Kullu. Clad with Deodar trees and Fir trees, these parks provide wonderful opportunity to spot some rare and native wildlife of Himachal Pradesh. You will too love to explore these parks on your visit to Kullu and Manali.

Tourists can also visit the famous Manali Sanctuary, Arjuna Gufa, apple orchards, Tibetan temple, Hidimba temple, etc as part of tour of Manali. Other tourist places around Manali include Keylong, Rohtang Pass, Raison, etc. These are perfect spot for adventure and sport activities. The places like Kasol, Kaishdhar, and Manikaran are also worth visitng.

In fact, the entire region of Kullu and Manali is very famous for its beauty and serenity. And that’s the reason it is also very popular among honeymooners. It is a heaven for honeymooners. You can too enjoy travel and tourism in Kullu and Manali region with Himachal tour package. Kullu and Manali also provide opportunity to head for Shimla – the capital of Himachal Pradesh, one of the most beautiful hill stations of India. Well, a visit to Kullu Manali definitely makes your trip to Himachal Pradesh memorable.

Tours to Shimla, Kullu and Manali in Himachal Pradesh

Shimla, Kullu and Manali are three prime travel and holiday destinations of Himachal Pradesh, India. These destinations are internationally famous for its cool & pleasant climate, beautiful landscapes, snow-capped mountain peaks, adventure & sports activities, religious spots, and several other picturesque attractions. I bet exploring these charming and captivating destinations of Himachal Pradesh will be a delightful experience that will last forever.

Shimla, once the capital of British Raj, is the capital of Himachal Pradesh, India. It is one of the most beautiful hill stations of the country. Top Five Wildlife Destination of Rajasthan Tours

Rajasthan, the largest state of India, is a haven for wide spectrum wildlife. Besides its magnificent monuments and rich culture & tradition the state is also known for its rich flora and fauna. There are several wildlife destinations in the state. Ranthambhore National Park, Desert National Park, Mount Abu Wildlife Sanctuary, Tal Chappar Sanctuary, Jaisamand Sanctuary, Darrah Sanctuary, Kumbhalgarh Sanctuary, Sariska Tiger Reserve & National Park, Keoladeo Ghana National Park (Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary), Gajner Wildlife Sanctuary, etc are names to few.

Exploring wildlife destinations of the state provides wonderful opportunity to see wildlife, birdlife and nature by close. These wildlife destinations of the state are ideal to enjoy nature tourism or green tourism. Tourists from all over the world visit Rajasthan and explore its rich flora and fauna at its several wildlife destinations. Below is useful information about top five wildlife destinations of the state. Surly the information will be very helpful for your Rajasthan Tours for wildlife destinations.

1. Ranthambhore National Park & Tiger Reserve
Ranthambhore National Park is one of the finest tiger reserves in India. It is one of the globally famous wildlife destinations of India. It is rich in its flora, fauna, and avifauna. It is famous for its royal Bengal tigers. One can watch sensational activities of tigers amidst their natural wild habitat. Other wildlife attractions that can be seen in this park are jungle cats, toddy cats, desert cats, leopards, chinkara, chital, sambar, striped hyenas, squirrels, five-striped squirrels, sloth bears, nilgai, deer, foxes, Indian flying foxes, mole rats, mongoose, etc. Also several species of birdlife can be seen in this park. There are about 272 species of birds in this park. Also different species of reptiles can be seen in this park. They are lizards, monitor lizards, crocodiles, vipers, snakes, Indian pythons, tortoises, turtles, cobras, etc. Thrilling and Sensations Experience!

2. Sariska National Park & Tiger Reserve
Not only Ranthambhore, the one another tiger land in Rajasthan India Tours is Sariska National Park & Tiger Reserve. The park is rich in its flora and fauna. The parks provides excellent haven for tigers and other wild animals and birdlife as well. Almost 90% of this wildlife sanctuary is dotted with dhok trees. Also trees of Khair, Ber, Tendu, etc are found this sanctuary. Wildlife attractions of the park are tigers, leopards, wild dogs, jungle cats, sambar, chinkara, chital, antelope, langoors, jackal, hyena, etc. Birdlife attractions of the park are peacocks, kingfishers, horned owls, red jungle fowl, peafowl, woodpeckers, quails, partridges, crested serpent eagles, sunbirds, spur fowls, golden backed woodpeckers, white breasted kingfishers, vultures etc. Delightful Experience!

3. Desert National Park
Established in 1980, it is a huge park spanning in the area of 3162 square kilometer. It is the excellent example of eco system. It has shrubs and trees and rolling sand dunes as well. The major wildlife attractions of the park are foxes, desert cats, hares, sand fish, lizards, desert monitor lizards, desert cats, jungle cats, desert mongoose, etc. Here one can see also see different bird species like sparrows, imperial sand grouse, bustards, falcons, eagles, and some of migratory birds. Pleasant Wildlife Experience!

4. Keoladeo Ghana National Park & Bird Sanctuary
Keoladeo Ghana National Park is one of the most popular bird sanctuaries in the world. It is haven for birds. Its shallow, fresh water marsh attracts thousands of migratory birds. The park is excellent example of eco system. There are infinite varieties of birds including migratory birds in this park. The park has been designated as the world heritage site. One of the popular ways to explore this world famous bird sanctuary is by a rickshaw ride. Also in the park wild animals are found such as sambar, chital, black buck, fishing cat, mongoose, etc. Wonder of Natural World!

5. Gajner Wildlife Sanctuary
Gajner is also famous wildlife destination of Rajasthan Tour among others. This sanctuary provides excellent ambiance for wildlife with lakes and forested hills. The prime attractions of this sanctuary are wild fowls, jungle cats, wild boar, desert foxes, deer, antelopes, blackbucks, blue bulls, etc. The lake at Gajner attracts water birds quite in good numbers. Delightful Experience!

If you too want to explore the famous wildlife destinations of Rajasthan you can go with one of Golden triangle tours that covers wildlife destination of the state. There are several travel agents and tour operators that offer tour packages for Rajasthan’s wildlife destinations. Well get ready to treasure delightful wildlife experience.

The palaces of Jaipur, lakes of Udaipur, and desert forts of Jodhpur, Bikaner & Jaisalmer are among the most preferred destination of many tourists, Indian and foreign.
